page.title: 12The Vineyard Page 2
page.content: {Growing the Vines Cuttings with about six buds are taken from the best vines. The cuttings have to be{one year old}before they can be planted out. The vines grow{two metres high}and the rows are planted{eight feet apart so that the sun can get to the grapes. The plants are{five feet apart.}The grapes are only up to{eighteen inches above the ground and the rest is leaves. They have to be planted out in straight lines. Each line is numbered and each row is labelled, when planted and the variety of grape. The variety of grapes grown are {Riesling, Sylvaner, Seyval Blanc}and {Reihenstener.}The juice from these is blended together to produce the wine. The vines do not mind how cold it is in the winter but they cannot survive late Spring frosts.
